cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 230 mi E of Tampico, Mexico and 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander through the western Gulf for the next couple of days, then gradually turn north-northwest and approach the central Texas coast early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (roughly between Port O’Connor and Freeport)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf Coast from northern Mexico northward to the Texas coastline, including the central Texas coast.
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 15% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds at the port, with gusty conditions most likely late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests 3–5 ft of surge is possible along the central Texas coast near and north of the eventual landfall point.
weather_observation.rainfall: Slow movement raises the potential for very heavy rainfall and localized totals in excess of 4 inches along the middle and upper Texas coast early next week.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and higher seas in the approaches to Freeport beginning this weekend could hamper vessel traffic and cargo operations.
